benefits_cohort.title: Small and Focussed Group
benefits_cohort.body: Each cohort will have close to ~25 people ensuring you have a richer learning experience.

benefits_cohort.title: Thrive Together
benefits_cohort.body: Unlike MOOCs where the information flow is unidirectional, the cohort here will thrive on interactions and collaborations.

benefits_cohort.title: Discuss and Learn
benefits_cohort.body: Learning happens when we discuss, and hence everyone is encouraged to speak, put forth opinions, and discuss.

benefits.title: Design systems like a pro
benefits.body: The course will make you comfortable at designing any system, no matter how stringent the requirements are.

benefits.title: Know the unknowns
benefits.body: Buckle up to learn some interesting concepts, super-clever algorithms, and sophisticated architectures. You are bound to have mind-blown moments.

benefits.title: Crack the interview
benefits.body: Be it FAANG or your dream startup, you would be at ease while designing systems in the interview round.

benefits.title: Upskill and level-up
benefits.body: Learn the designing paradigms and upskill yourself to accelerate your career growth and stand out.

benefits.title: Network and Community
benefits.body: Perhaps the most interesting takeaway will be your new network, friends, and a lot of memories.

outline.title: Week 1
outline.body: The first week is about learning the macro and micro components of System Design.

outline.title: Week 2
outline.body: This week we will focus on learning everything about databases, right from SQL to NoSQL to Embedded, going through the internals, and understanding how they scale.

outline.title: Week 3
outline.body: The third week will be about understanding Distributed Systems and the challenges that come while building them.

outline.title: Week 4
outline.body: This is when we start modeling and building real-world systems and we start with Social Networks.

outline.title: Week 5
outline.body: This week will be about building ephemeral, persistent, reliable and durable storage engines.

outline.title: Week 6
outline.body: This week we level-up and build systems that are heavily concurrent and required to deliver very high throughput.

outline.title: Week 7
outline.body: This week is about understanding the internals of Information Retrieval Systems.

outline.title: Week 8
outline.body: The final week will be about exploring systems that are driven by a super-clever algorithm.

value_proposition: 40 hours of Live Interactive Classes on Weekends
Lifetime access to all the Curriculum Resources
Lifetime access to the Network and Community

faqs.title: Is this course right for me?
faqs.body: This course is for any engineer who wants to learn System Design. The program is most suited to someone who has some industry experience, about 1-5 years.

faqs.title: Will you be giving teching for the entire duration?
faqs.body: Yes. I will be teaching the entire course live over Zoom and will be providing feedbacks and 1:1 mentorship.

faqs.title: Will there be a class every day?
faqs.body: The Live Classess will happen on Saturdays and Sundays 4-6pm IST with a possible extension of 30/45 mins.

faqs.title: Will there be a reserved slots for 1:1 mentorship?
faqs.body: 1:1 mentorship calls will happen on-demand, just drop me a message a day prior and I will get our call scheduled.

faqs.title: Will there be assignments and hands-on projects?
faqs.body: Apart from Live Classess on weekends there will be multiple assignments and projects ensuring you apply what you learn. Unfortunately due to time constraints the evaluations of assignments is not possible, but I highly encourage you to implement all the assignments and seek help during 1:1 sessions.

faqs.title: Are assignments and projects mandatory?
faqs.body: No. But it is advisable that you complete them to get a better understanding of the system, algorithm and business logic.

faqs.title: Will we also implement and see the systems in action?
faqs.body: Due to time constraint it is not possible to implement every system; it is recommended that you self-implement the system and understand the low level details. Course although will cover systems from every aspect.

faqs.title: Will there be a recording available for future reference?
faqs.body: Every single Live Class will be recorded and you will be given lifetime access to it.

faqs.title: Is there a refund policy?
faqs.body: 14 days (from the course commencement) is the window within which you can claim a full refund. No Questions Asked.

faqs.title: Where are the classes conducted?
faqs.body: All Live Classes will be online, over Zoom, and all you need is an internet connection to attend the live sessions.

faqs.title: Who you be the only one teaching this course?
faqs.body: The entire course including Live Classes will be conducted by me, Arpit Bhayani, no external TAs, mentors, etc. You will get to learn everything from the horse's mouth.

faqs.title: What are the programming pre-requisites?
faqs.body: You need to have work experience of 6 months at the least and a working knowledge of one language - either Python, Java, Golang, or NodeJS. Most of the exercises and assignments will be language agnostic but depending on the problem statement you may have to pick one over the other.

faqs.title: How is this course different from free videos on YouTube?
faqs.body: This cohort-based course aims to be live, intense, and interactive. Traditional MooCs (existing videos on the internet) cannot offer these benefits as are unidirectional and optimizes for one-to-many. With this course being live you can get instant resolution to your doubts. The discussion, collaboration, and networking will have a major impact on your overall learning as there will be cross-pollination of information.

faqs.title: If I have already watched System Design videos on YouTube, is this course still helpful?
faqs.body: Yes. The kind of depth which is touched in this System Design is unmatched. Even if you have watched all the System Design videos out there, you will still have moments that will blow your mind.

faqs.title: Will I be getting an invoice of Payment?
faqs.body: Yes. An invoice will be issued to you with all the legal and necessary details. This means your employer can choose to process this invoice and provide reimbursement.
